title: OS Level 6 — Semaphores & Classic Synchronization Problems
intro: This level introduces semaphores and standard synchronization problems.
points: Define semaphore and understand its two main operations: wait(P) and signal(V).
Difference between binary semaphore and counting semaphore.
Use semaphores conceptually to solve synchronization problems.
Classical problems: Producer–Consumer (Bounded Buffer), Readers–Writers, Dining Philosophers (concept solutions).
Understand how incorrect use of semaphores can cause deadlock or starvation.
